content.title: CHOOSING YOUR HERO
content.body:
To streamline setup, we’ve prepared premade builds for the entire Party. Each Player simply chooses one of the four Heroes listed below, and all progress choices are already selected so you can begin playing immediately.

For this Adventure, we’ll be using the Heroes Vorn, Lorelai, Jaheen, and Maya, together with the Dungeon Roles Defender, Controller, Support, and Striker.

Accordingly, take all components that belong to Elros, as well as the Leader Dungeon Role cards, and set them aside for this walkthrough.

We will also use the non-tutorial side of the Hero Board, as shown below:

Keep your Player Aid close at hand. We’ll refer to it occasionally, and you can use it to clarify any questions that come up regarding Keywords or the turn structure.

When choosing a Hero, take all associated components:

  • Hero Card
  • Hero Skills
  • Equipment Cards
  • Class Abilities
  • Dungeon Role Skills
  • Action Cubes (AC)

content.title: VORN – PARTY TANK
content.body:
Vorn is the frontline protector of the group. His premade build includes:

Dungeon Role: Defender

Take 2 Defender Dungeon Role cards, each with 2 abilities.

Hero Skills

  • Knee-Breaker (Melee)
  • Strong Block (Ranged)
  • Barrel Roll (Agility)

This gives him three Level 1 Hero Skill cards, plus 1 Action Cube for each Skill:

  • 1 Yellow AC for Melee skills
  • 1 Red AC for Ranged skills
  • 1 Green AC for Agility skills

Class Abilities

  • Battle Breath (Discipline)
  • Tackle (Tactics)

content.title: LORELAI – PARTY CONTROLLER
content.body:

  • 2 Blue AC for Wisdom skills

Class Abilities

  • Spell Power (Arcane)
  • Researcher (Arcane)

content.title: PLAYER GIFTS
content.body:
Ask the Store Owner for the Gift Equipment deck. Each Hero takes 1 card of their choice and Equips it to the appropriate slot. Remember to check your Hero's Proficiency (bottom of the Hero Board). These cards are the reward for participating in the Adventure The Underkeep. For each Hero, we suggest the following Gift Equipment to be used in this Adventure:

  • Vorn: Adamantine Gauntlet - This Equipment makes that any time you discard a SHIELD Token to prevent damage, it prevents 2 damage instead of 1.
  • Lorelai: Heart of Narang’Erel - This Relic provides you with a Skill that makes up for a great way to gain Focus for your powerful Focus Skills.
  • Jaheen: Quicksilver Buckler - This Shield carries a Skill that can save a teammate in a pinch, changing the target of an Attack to you and softening the blow.
  • Maya: Dimension Tearer - It’s Skill offers you some protection and one more chance to trigger your Passive Skill “Best Friends”.

Now, place each Hero in the appropriate slot on the Initiative Track, according to their Dungeon Role:

content.title: FIRST ROOM SETUP
content.body:
Next, we are going to prepare the Setup for the First Room.

This image shows the starting positions of all Heroes, Monsters, and Objects in the room.

How to read the legend:

Each icon represents the token or miniature that must be placed in that exact spot.

The labels “2+”, “3+”, and “4+” tell you how many Heroes must be in the party for that element to appear.

  • With 2 Heroes, place the Heroes, the Interaction token, the 3 Chest tokens, and the first set of Monsters.
  • With 3 Heroes, add one additional Dead Marksman and one Crypt Guardian in their marked positions.
  • With 4 Heroes, add one more Dead Marksman.

Monster identification:

To track each Monster’s HP individually, attach a colored snap to every miniature.

Example with 4 Heroes:

  • Use one Monster Board to track the Dead Marksmen, and another to track the Crypt Guardians.
  • Attach the Yellow, Light Blue, Pink, and Green snaps to the Dead Marksmen.
  • Attach the Red and Black snaps to the Crypt Guardians.

Then place all Monsters on their indicated spots on the map.

Monsters of the same type may be placed in any order—you choose which snap color goes on which position.

Now, also place the Monster cards in the Initiative Track. The Dead Marksmen goes in the “Blue Up” slot and the Crypt Guardians go in the “Orange Down” slot.

content.title: GAMEPLAY WALKTHROUGH
content.body:
Now that all Heroes are ready, it’s time to begin.

We will walk through the start of a round to demonstrate the basic turn cycle and the core mechanics of play. After you finish reading this simulation, you may either continue the Adventure from that point — moving on to the next Character in order (Lorelai) — or restart the round and replay Vorn’s turn as you prefer.

The Initiative Track indicates that Vorn is the first Character to act this round. Before taking any actions, Vorn checks whether he is affected by any Conditions — and in this case, he isn’t. He then verifies if any of his abilities trigger at the start of his turn. His Class Ability, “Battle Breath,” activates at the Beginning of Turn and grants him 2 Shield Tokens.

Now we move to the “Take Actions” step.

For his first Cube Action, Vorn takes a Red Cube and places it on the “Hammer Throw” skill.

He begins by resolving the first effect of the skill: “Self: Shield 2.” Vorn gains 2 additional Shield Tokens, reaching the maximum of 4. (Note: all Stackable Tokens have a maximum capacity of 4 stacks.)

Next, he resolves the damage portion of the skill, which deals 3 Ranged Damage to a target within the skill’s range. Since this is a Red Cube Action, its range is 1 Area.

The only enemy within range is the Red Crypt Guardian, so Vorn chooses that target and records the damage on the Monster Board.

Now Vorn uses his Free Movement, repositioning himself next to the Crypt Guardian.

By ending his movement adjacent to the Guardian, he triggers his “Tackle” Class Ability, which immediately deals 2 damage to the Monster.

For his Minor Action, Vorn chooses to activate his weapon’s “Versatile” ability, flipping it to its alternate side.

For his second Cube Action, he selects his “Guarding Blow” Melee skill.

He begins by resolving the first effect of the skill, which allows him to choose any target within Melee Range to receive Shield 2. Since Vorn is already at the maximum capacity of Shield Tokens, he decides to assign the 2 Shield Tokens to Jaheen instead.

The next part of the skill instructs Vorn to make a Melee attack roll with +5 to hit. This means he rolls a D20 and adds +5 to the result.

If the final number meets or exceeds his weapon’s Accuracy Value (12), the attack hits and deals damage equal to the weapon’s Damage Attribute (6).

For this example, we’ll assume the attack is successful.

Vorn deals 6 damage to the Crypt Guardian and records this on the Monster Board.

After taking all the Actions available to him, Vorn ends his turn.

content.title: MONSTERS’ TURN
content.body:
The Round then proceeds to the next Character on the Initiative Track: the Dead Marksmen.

We activate the Monsters following the color order shown on the Monster Board.

The first to act is the Yellow Dead Marksman.

Looking at its card, we see that its target priority is the STRONGEST HERO, which means it will choose the Hero with the highest HP among those it can reach.

In this situation, that target is Vorn.

First, the Marksman attempts to move into range of its target.

It only needs to advance 2 squares to reach Range 1 of Vorn.

Once in range, it proceeds to deal its damage (9) to Vorn.

However, this attack creates an opportunity for the Heroes to react before the damage is applied.

The first step in resolving the attack is removing Vorn’s 4 Shield Tokens, each preventing 1 damage. After the Shields are discarded, 5 damage remain to be dealt.

Each Hero may use one Reaction for each Hero being attacked.

Jaheen decides to react by using his “Shielding Faith” skill, which prevents 3 damage and also ensures that Vorn will not suffer any Collateral Damage from this attack.

With the prevention applied, Vorn takes 2 damage, and although the attack would normally inflict Collateral Damage (Poison 2), Jaheen’s reaction cancels that effect entirely.

This concludes the activation of the first Dead Marksman.

Following the color order on the Monster Board, the next to activate is the Light Blue Marksman. Its target is again the Strongest Hero, which is still Vorn. It moves up to its full Movement value (3) toward him, but this is not enough to reach Range 1, so it ends its activation without making an attack.

The same situation occurs with the Pink and Green Marksmen: each one moves as close as possible to its target and then ends its activation, unable to get within attack range.

This concludes the Dead Marksmen’s turn.

The next Character on the Initiative Track is Lorelai. Begin her turn by following the steps outlined on the player aid, and then continue with the Adventure.

This concludes this Start Here guide. Now, you can choose to either restart the Adventure or continue playing from Lorelai’s turn. If you have any questions regarding Keywords or the mechanics of the turn, feel free to check the Player Aid or the Keyword tab on the Drunagor App.
